article:
A 'test' is a term used to refer to the shell of sea urchins, and also the shell
of certain microorganisms, such as testate foraminifera and testate amoebae.

In ascidians the test is composed largely of cellulose (historically termed
"tunicine"). From 1845 (when this was discovered by Schmidt) until 1958 (when
cellulose fibres were found in mammalian connective tissue), ascidians were
studied under the belief to be the only animals that synthesised
cellulose. Endean, [http://jcs.biologists.org/content/s3-102/57/107.full.pdf
The Test of the Ascidian, Phallusia mammillata], Quarterly Journal of
Microscopical Science, Vol. 102, part 1, pp. 107-117, 1961.
